page.title:
National Park Service Inventory and Monitoring Program
National Park Service Inventory and Monitoring Program
page.normal_text:
“The overall purpose of natural resource monitoring in parks is to develop scientifically sound information on the current status and long term trends in the composition, structure, and function of park ecosystems, and to determine how well current management practices are sustaining those ecosystems.”
“The overall purpose of natural resource
monitoring in parks is to develop scientifically
sound information on the current status and long
term trends in the composition, structure, and
function of park ecosystems, and to determine how
well current management practices are sustaining
those ecosystems.”

Fancy et al. 2008, Env. Mon. Ass.
Fancy et al. 2008, Env. Mon. Ass.

page.title:
Ecological Conditions of US National Parks: Enabling Decision Support Through Monitoring, Analysis, and Forecasting
Ecological Conditions of US National Parks: Enabling
Decision Support Through Monitoring, Analysis, and
Forecasting
page.normal_text:
Goal: Integrate the routine acquisition and analysis of NASA products and other data sources into NPS I&M Program and use these NASA products to evaluate and forecast ecological condition of US National Parks.
Goal: Integrate the routine acquisition and analysis of NASA products and other
data sources into NPS I&M Program and use these NASA products to evaluate
and forecast ecological condition of US National Parks.
page.enlisting:
▪ Identify NASA and other products useful to park monitoring ▪ Delineate the boundaries of the park-centered ecosystems appropriate for monitoring. ▪ Add value to these data sets for understanding change through analysis and forecasting. ▪ Deliver these products and a means to integrate them into the NPS I&M decision support framework. ▪ Identify NASA and other products useful to park monitoring

page.title:
Objective 1a: Indicators
Objective 1a: Indicators
page.normal_text:
1. Evaluate which TOPS and other products are most relevant to parks monitoring. 2. Select potential high priority indicators in context of NPS I&M conceptual models and I&M scientists.
1. Evaluate which TOPS and other products are most relevant to parks monitoring.
2. Select potential high priority indicators in context of NPS I&M conceptual
models and I&M scientists.
